comments.author: Heather
comments.content: Thanks for these tips for vegetarian Thanksgiving entrées.  One of my favorites, for Thanksgiving & Christmas, is cabbage stuffed with a rice-and-chickpeas mixture, which I've adapted from a recipe in Claudia Roden's classic "New Book of Middle Eastern Food."  And, like the best Thanksgiving food out there, it tastes even better reheated the next day!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Mmm, that sounds like a great choice for a Thanksgiving entree!

comments.author: YumVeggieBurger
comments.content: The stuffed squash is such a beautiful presentation!  Much prettier than any meat entree :)

comments.author: Maria
comments.content: I loved the stuffed pumpkin! I am always checking out how to use Orzo in tasty ways. Here in Greece it is common to cook orzo in a clay pot in the oven, together with meat and tomatoes. I would like a veggie version. But this was great, also for the Christmas table! Thanks!
